Dear Friends and Visitors,

Today's world is like a stormy ocean, with a fragmented culture, climate change issues, conflicts in Ukraine, the Middle East, and Burma, and mass migrations acting as turbulent waves, leaving us with a profound need for guidance. Our society, both within and outside the Catholic Church, faces deep polarization, making Christâ€™s guiding and inspiring light more essential than ever.

The image of the Christ Child, peacefully resting amidst the turbulent waters of a stormy sea, beautifully captures our need for His light. This year's Christmas Festival of Lights, themed "Christ Be Our Light," aims to offer our visitors and pilgrims an opportunity to experience not only the beauty and magic of our Christmas lights, but also to remember the profound hope that Christ's light brought into the world on that holy night in Bethlehem. This Christmas season, may His light shine brightly in your hearts and homes.

Warm wishes for a blessed Advent and Christmas Season.

The Missionaries of Our Lady of La Salette.

This remarkable museum showcases an impressive and diverse array of cultural interpretations of the nativity story, featuring some 2,000 nativity scenes from more than 100 countries worldwide. Among its treasures are 2 unique collections of 'Santons' from Provence, France, offering visitors a captivating glimpse into the global and artistic celebration of Christmas. While admission is free, the museum appreciates free-will donations for its upkeep.

MONDAY - SUNDAY 10:00 a.m. - 9:00 p.m.

The permanent display titled "Judea, Jerusalem, and Galilee at the Time of Jesus" presents an extraordinary opportunity for visitors to immerse themselves in the rich and multifaceted tapestry of the life and ministry of one of history's most influential figures: Jesus of Nazareth.

The exhibit, made possible by Richard Picotte's precious donation, offers a unique and in-depth exploration of the landscapes, cultures, and daily life during the time of Jesus, providing an unparalleled insight into the historical and religious context of his teachings and works.

Capture the magic of the season with "Photo with Santa" at the National Shrine of Our Lady of La Salette! Bring your family and friends to meet Santa and take memorable photos every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 5:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. This cherished holiday tradition is perfect for creating lasting memories and spreading festive cheer. Join us and make your holiday season even more special!
